column9:
183: Thank you for collaborating with the Accelerated CREP project. As we continue to work on finishing steps we want to make sure we are reporting each authors contribution correctly. Please fill out this survey with your information and contribution to be reported in the final paper of this project.
For the questions about your name, think of your full name, as you would like it to appear in print. Then, let us know the first name, middle initial, and last name/surname that you would like associated with the publication.
This information will allow us to enter you as an author in Manuscript Central. If you have an existing AMPPS Manuscript Central account, please provide the email address associated with that account. If you would like to link an ORCID to this publication, you will need to add your ORCID to the account in Manuscript Central tied to the email address you use for this publication.
This survey does not ask about whether you agree to the submission of Stage 2 Registered Report. That Registered Report is being written and we will ask you to complete a different survey after you have reviewed that draft.
column11: 185: What is your full name? Please include first name, middle initials if you would like to include them, and last/family name.
column13: 186: How would your name appear in a citation? (e.g., Wagge, J. R.)
column15: 187: What email address would you like associated with this publication?
column17:
30: Are all of your lab students or other members of your institution listed as authors and members of this canvas page? If you are unsure, please list all of your local collaborators and we will use this information to double-check our author list.
If you want to see who is listed, you can click on People to view the people in this study. You should open this in a new window though so not to lose your survey answers. 
If students have graduated, and you know their new email addresses, please list them here.
column19:
184: Note (from AMPPS submission portal): "AMPPS requires institution, department, and country information for all authors ... Please be aware that if authors wish to have a manuscript associated with their ORCID identifier, they must be listed here and must make sure their account linked to ORCID. ORCID must be linked to author accounts prior to manuscript acceptance or they will not be displayed upon publication. ORCID cannot be linked during the copy editing phase."
IMPORTANT: In order to adhere to SAGE’s authorship criteria authors must have been responsible for at least one of the following CReDiT roles:

Conceptualization
Methodology
Formal Analysis
Investigation

AND at least one of the following:

Writing – Original Draft Preparation
Writing – Review  Editing
column21:
188: Which of the following CREDIT taxonomy contributions did you make to this project? Select all that apply: (view this link for CREDIT descriptions: https://credit.niso.org/)
Please note: you may see items marked as "incorrect" - they are not correct or incorrect, the system just does this automatically.
column23:
189: From AMPPS authorship guidelines: "In complete sentences, authors should precisely describe their contributions to the research and manuscript, identifying each author by his or her initials and surname. For example: “D. J. Simons and A. O. Holcombe jointly generated the idea for the study. A. O. Holcombe programmed the study and collected the data. D. J. Simons wrote the analysis code and analyzed the data, and A. O. Holcombe verified the accuracy of those analyses. D. J. Simons wrote the first draft of the manuscript, and both authors critically edited it. Both authors approved the final submitted version of the manuscript.”
Using the above paragraph as an example, please write a similar sentence that describes your contributions to this project (e.g. J. R. Wagge contributed to conceptualization, data curation, methodology, supervision, writing, and served as an Executive Reviewer for CREP reviews for projects)

column87:
Note -- Strongly suggest that we do not ask Question 7 because people do not report this accurately and we have this documented.

 

I also would consider prompting people to email rather than submit a question here because we might not be reviewing these immediately.
